document_data.mainbody: '''Ketheric Thorm's war''' was a conflict between the [[chosen]] of [[Shar]], [[Ketheric Thorm]] and the [[Harpers]] , that took place in the [[Chionthar Valley]] in the 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

Conflict pre-history.Selûnite Resistance:
After Ketheric's conversion to Shar, not all inhabitants of the lands controlled by him did the same. Those that did not convert were declared heretics and persecuted. Inquisitor [[Verzen Wranlock]]'s ''[[Investigation Notes]]'' shed light on some measures used in Reithwin to find the worshipers of Selûne.

*''[[Letter of Surrender]]''
Course of the war.Yurgir's Onslaught:
As Morfred wrote in his log, during the last year of the war, he met [[Raphael]], [[Mephistopheles]]' son, who offered him a [[Infernal contract|bargain]]. Raphael promised to get rid of Ketheric's army in exchange for Morfred's soul. Morfred accepted the offer and was transferred to the [[House of Hope]] where he stayed ever since as an eternal debtor of the [[cambion]].

Raphael fulfilled the deal, sending [[orthon]] [[Yurgir]] and his [[merregon]]s to Grymforge. Within the ''[[Sharran's Journal]]'', there was an account of one of Dark Justiciars witnessing Yurgir's onslaught. Most of the Sharrans were wiped out during the first day. The others continued to fight back or hide for some time as the author of the ''[[Abandoned Journal]]''. The garrisons of the Gauntlet of Shar and of Grymforge slipped out of existence, but Yurgir's contract would remain unfulfilled until [[1492 DR]] as, unknown to him, Raphael had also made a contract with one of Dark Justiciars called [[Lyrthindor]], hiding his presence from the orthon and foredooming Yurgir to wander the Sharran temple for over a century.
Course of the war.Shadow Curse:
[[File:Statue of Ketheric Thorm.png|thumb|Statue of Ketheric Thorm in [[Reithwin]] after the [[Shadow-cursed lands|shadow curse]] was cast upon the town.]]
Following the near-complete destruction of Ketheric's army of Dark Justiciars, his Sharran army was defeated and Ketheric himself killed. Not long after his entombment in the Thorm Mausoleum, however, the lands surrounding Moonrise Towers were stricken with a [[Shadow-cursed lands|shadow curse]], plunging the region into malevolent shadow for over a century. The curse affected the armies of both sides and the locals without distinction, turning many into undead shadows that sought only to consume the living. Halsin's ''[[Druid Notebook]]'' mentions an acquaintance turning into a shadow that possessed a glaive. After the shadow was laid to rest, its glaive was brought to Emerald Grove and named [[Sorrow]] as a constant reminder of what was lost in the war.

document_data.Aftermath:
[[File:The Towers Seized.png|thumb|240px|]]

For many years Emerald Grove druids and Harpers tried to find the way to fight the shadow curse and to heal the lands affected by it.
document_data.Influence: *[[Roan Featherway]], a druid and Halsin's acquaintance, wrote a "poorly written romance with no basis in fact", called ''[[Shadow's Kiss]]'' around the events of that war.
